body.p: When you use a task link that is sent to you by the Content Author, the interface is opened in your most recently used browser and the task details are displayed.
When logged in as a Reviewer, the interface includes the following options and components:

dlentry.dd:
The main interface presents the task with all the attached files listed and a few options for communicating the Content Author or other Reviewers.
Files to review You can click on any of the files attached to the task to open it in Oxygen XML Web Author. This is the editor that you will use to proofread, make changes, and add comments in the files.
LOOKS GOOD You can click this button to send a predefined "Looks Good" message to the Content Author. The most common use for this button is that it simply offers a very quick way to let the Content Author know that all the files have been reviewed and they look good without needing any changes.
ADD MESSAGE You can use this button to add messages to communicate with the Content Author or other Reviewers.

Your user name is displayed in the top-right corner of the page. If you click on your name, you have access to the following options:
Profile Opens your profile information page that displays your name, email, avatar, and allows you to delete your profile.
My Tasks Displays a list of all the current tasks that you created and uploaded. Clicking on a task name will open it in the Details Tab.
Sign Out Signs you out of the interface.
